top.title: EU adds Iran's Revolutionary Guards to terrorist list
top.summary: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas says the move is a response to Tehran's deadly crackdown on protesters.

top.title: 'I can breathe again' says Israeli hostage held for nearly 500 days in Gaza
top.summary: In his first international interview, Sasha Troufanov tells the BBC how he thought he would die in captivity after he was taken hostage on 7 October 2023.

top.title: France moves to abolish concept of marital duty to have sex
top.summary: The proposed bill would enshrine in law the end of so-called "conjugal rights" – the notion that marriage means a duty to have sex.

top.title: UK bans Coinbase ads implying crypto can ease cost of living concerns
top.summary: The ASA upheld complaints that Coinbase's adverts trivialised the risks of investing in cryptocurrency.

top.title: Driverless taxis set to launch in UK as soon as September
top.summary: Waymo has laid out plans for a robotaxi service in London with a pilot scheme due to begin in April.

top.title: Tesla cuts car models in shift to robots and AI
top.summary: Multi-billionaire Elon Musk's electric car maker also said its annual revenue had fallen for the first time.

title.#text: Everything is gambling now: the latest news on prediction markets like Polymarket and Kalshi
Spotify’s new group chats share music with everyone in your circle
Half of developers think gen AI is bad for the gaming industry
